conclusion: Need to analyze p-T and V-T graphs to determine pressure at 600 K.
At 400 K, volume is 2 m³; at 600 K, volume increases to 3 m³.
Gas undergoes an isobaric process between 400 K and 600 K.
From p-T graph, pressure at 400 K is approximately 1.05 × 10^5 Pa.
Pressure at 600 K is the same as at 400 K, approximately 1.05 × 10^5 Pa.
Pressure of the gas at 600 K is 1.05 × 10^5 Pa.
